channel.title: Comments on: WordPress 2.6 – XML-RPC & AtomPub Changes

item.title: By: Jeffrey
item.dc:creator: Jeffrey
item.description: I agree there definitely needs to be more emphasis on closing tickets in a more timely manner. I like WP 2.6 and have had no problems yet but the concern is always there.
item.content:encoded: I agree there definitely needs to be more emphasis on closing tickets in a more timely manner. I like WP 2.6 and have had no problems yet but the concern is always there.

item.title: By: Utkusoft
item.dc:creator: Utkusoft
item.description: oh it's very useful information.Thanks a lot ;)
item.content:encoded: oh it’s very useful information.Thanks a lot ðŸ˜‰

item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description: Yes, I saw Sam's post. That was kind of my point, we need more folks to get involved. With more people participating in XML-RPC and AtomPub development, tickets would be more likely to get the attention they need.
item.content:encoded: Yes, I saw Sam’s post. That was kind of my point, we need more folks to get involved. With more people participating in XML-RPC and AtomPub development, tickets would be more likely to get the attention they need.

item.title: By: Benedict Eastaugh
item.dc:creator: Benedict Eastaugh
item.description: I take it you've seen <a href="http://intertwingly.net/blog/2008/07/15/Stalled-Tickets" rel="nofollow">Sam Ruby's take</a> on this?
item.content:encoded: I take it you’ve seen Sam Ruby’s take on this?
